name: GetUserTaskList
description:
Retrieve tasks in a user's My Tasks list.

Fetches a compact list of tasks for a user's My Tasks list from Asana. It includes both complete and incomplete tasks unless filtered. Access control applies, so private tasks are excluded if the authenticated user lacks permissions.

parameters.name: user_task_list_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the user's task list. This ID is required to fetch tasks from the specified user list.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the user task list.

parameters.name: filter_completed_tasks_since
parameters.description: Return only tasks that are either incomplete or completed since this date-time or the keyword 'now'.

value_schema.description: Only return tasks that are either incomplete or that have been completed since this time. Accepts a date-time string or the keyword *now*.

parameters.name: tasks_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of tasks to return per page, between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: Offset token for pagination. Use the token returned from a previous request to fetch the next page. If not provided, the first page is returned.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: include_optional_fields
parameters.description: List the optional properties to include in the response, as a list of strings. These properties are excluded by default.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable pretty output to make the JSON response more readable. This increases response time and size, so it's recommended for debugging only.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: completed_since
parameters.description: Only return tasks that are either incomplete or that have been completed since this time. Accepts a date-time string or the keyword *now*.

value_schema.description: Only return tasks that are either incomplete or that have been completed since this time. Accepts a date-time string or the keyword *now*.

Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.

*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.
